<<<<<<< HEAD
The povver of the Christian magistrate in sacred things Delivered in some positions, sent to a friend, upon which, a returne of his opinion was desired. With some considerations, upon the answer; and a digression concerning allegiance, and submission to the supreame magistrate. By Lewis du Moulin, History-reader of the University of Oxford. Du Moulin, Lewis, 1606-1680.
[8], 151, [1] p.
Printed by G. Dawson, for Francis Eglesfield, at the Marygold in Pauls Church-yard, London : 1650.
Annotation on Thomason copy: "Mar 28". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
